comment.body:
> However I doubt if a search engine is necessary.So what's your opinion.

I guess we need a metadata tracker and aggregator. It should be not just a search engine, but a tracker of all the network activity, per user, per data type (posts, comments, published files etc), per topic and so on.

> It's impossible to catch unpublished sites except using virusesðŸ˜‚

Not sure if that sentence applies to ZeroNet or IPFS. In ZeroNet, you can run your own `zero://` tracker and dump the sites from its database. By default, ZeroNet publish all the addresses to the trackers (except `pause`d ones, I guess).

@ssdifnskdjfnsdjk@zeroid.bit: It's probably possible to implement a plugin for ZeroNet, that builds an indexed DB and improves the search speed greately. What about decentralized solutions, I think of https://yacy.net/. A similar engine can be implemented on top of ZeroNet too.
ZeroNet over Tor doesn't work either?
Wow, how is it possible for Tox to work then? Doesn't it route all the traffic over Tor too?
If Tox does work, can we route ZeroNet traffic over Tox somehow?
That's cool. I envy it wasn't me who implemented that. :D

No doubt, it can be a great network, if it ever be implemented and released.
However...
What's the point of making yet another p2p network, when we have no manpower even for this one?

> I really don't want to start a project that people start relying on, only to let people down a month or so down the line (again), because that's pretty selfish.

Any contributions to existing projects are still welcome.

> I honestly thought back in ~2016(?) that it would have grown exponentially from that point onwards, but things appear to have stagnated a little

There was some growth until the last year. Not so big, but anyway...

And now ZeroNet looks abandoned by many users.

Still many new registration every day here on ZeroMe, you can lots of "Hello ZeroMe!" messages, but nobody writes anything.

We have no devs, you know. Any help is greatly appreciated.
